children: A 54-year-old man is evaluated for a persistent and progressive pruritic skin condition of the trunk, arms, and palms, including both sun-exposed and sun-protected skin.
Representative findings on the posterior thorax are
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

The most likely diagnosis is mycosis fungoides, a subtype of cutaneous T-cell lymphoma. The disease has various presentations; the most common presentation consists of persistent and/or progressive large, often pruritic, scaly patches or plaques that vary in size, shape, and color. Lesions occur on both sun-exposed and sun-protected skin. Diagnosis is made by skin biopsy.
